item.title: RoR or PHP?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“X Entinity X, post:48, topic:430287”]PHP, it’s definetly the most powerful and supported language.[/quote]no it’s shit

[quote=“Zukyak, post:49, topic:430287”]PHP has a much bigger library and has been around for a lot longer… If you were to google a fix for a PHP problem, you’d find one from like 8 years ago and it’d still work.

RoR is quite faster from what I’ve seen and heard.[/quote]RoR’s scalability sucks as twitter demonstrated

item.title: RoR or PHP?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:37, topic:430287”]Since no one has said use PHP, I’ll play a bit of devil’s advocate here. Personally I think PHP is an awful language, but so much code I have to interface with (like SMF) is PHP it just makes sense to continue to use it.

Also, what about the issue of hosts? PHP is supported on every web host I’ve seen, where do you go for rails hosting if you don’t do it yourself on a VPS or a dedicated server? Same question for python/django?[/quote]

Host gator supports RoR for their shared servers but they are using a terribad version of it. Bastards won’t allow me to install some of the gems I need in order to work on my current projects. To be truthful, I just like the Ruby language although I plan eventually on getting deeper into Python in the future. Never tried Django although s_ suggested it to me somewhere. I’ll look into it. I can’t give a good comparison between RoR and Django until I get a good amount of time under my belt with Django.

Speaking of new cool languages, has anyone tried Coffeescript?

Read full topic

item.title: RoR or PHP?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Since no one has said use PHP, I’ll play a bit of devil’s advocate here. Personally I think PHP is an awful language, but so much code I have to interface with (like SMF) is PHP it just makes sense to continue to use it.

Also, what about the issue of hosts? PHP is supported on every web host I’ve seen, where do you go for rails hosting if you don’t do it yourself on a VPS or a dedicated server? Same question for python/django?

Read full topic

item.title: RoR or PHP?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote="s, post:33, topic:430287"][quote author=lemme_winks link=topic=532967.msg3898423#msg3898423 date=1327534160]

[quote author=_s link=topic=532967.msg3898416#msg3898416 date=1327533877]

[quote author=t4 link=topic=532967.msg3898405#msg3898405 date=1327533155]

[quote author=_s link=topic=532967.msg3898398#msg3898398 date=1327532840]

apparently any asshold can get CM/awards now, oh well.

(not implying you’re a bad programmer, just implying existing cup owners are better – but then again, they’ve released nothing in ages)
[/quote]GIEF MY LISP GURU

((()()())()()())()()()(()

Considering I am one of the only people around here that uses C++ (everyone else is mostly a C fanboy), I should receive togepi!
[/quote]bullshit you didn’t even know C++11 had been finalised

just because i live under a rock doesn’t mean i don’t know how to program in c++
[/quote]the average C++ programmer is a C programmer that can use classes, or in other words, the average C++ programmer is not a C++ programmer.

the average objective-c programmer is a c programmer that can use classes. the average c++ programmer is a c++ programmer.
[/quote]the joke was that a huge majority of C++ programmers are bad and literally use C++ for nothing more than the convenient syntax for defining classes, everything else is just C or pseudo-C++[/quote]
perhaps true, but we have boost

Read full topic
